data.name: Statutory Trust Account
data.description: A trust account to meet the specific needs and statutory requirements of Law firms seeking to hold funds in trust with the Law Society of NSW per industry requirements.

features.additionalInfo: Bank 24/7 wherever you are and whenever you want with RAB mobile and internet banking.
A cheque book is available on request. For full details refer to our Conditions of Use. Fees and charges apply.
Combined balances of up to $250,000 per account holder are guaranteed and secured by the Australian Government.
Full branch access for deposits, withdrawals or counter cheques, however no cash withdrawals are allowed.

constraints.additionalInfo: A minimum balance of $1 is required to earn interest on this product.

eligibility.additionalInfo: As a customer-owned bank, customers must also become a shareholder of Regional Australia Bank to be eligible to open an account.
A Statutory Trust Account must be operating alongside a general account under the same membership number so that any fees relating to the operation of the trust can be charged.
The customer must be a trading Law Firm.

fees.name: Staff Assisted Fee- Industry Trust Accounts
fees.additionalInfo: Applies per withdrawal or debit transfer processed by branch or Service Support Centre Staff. No fees can be charged to this account. Any applicable fees will be charged to another account under your membership.

fees.name: Cheque Deposit Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Your first 10 cheque deposits to your membership each month are free, each subsequent deposit will be charged per cheque. No fees can be charged to this account. Any applicable fees will be charged to another account under your membership.

fees.name: Financial Institution Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applies for each bank cheque you order from us. No fees can be charged to this account. Any applicable fees will be charged to another account under your membership.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Interest rates are available on request for this product. Interest is calculated on the daily balance and paid to the Law Society Monthly.
